decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful board presence by attaching powerful auras to your creatures, making them stronger and more resilient. By utilizing a combination of cheap creatures and powerful enchantments like Ethereal Armor and All That Glitters, you can overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of protection spells like Karametra's Blessing and Alseid of Life's Bounty helps to protect your key pieces, allowing you to maintain pressure on your opponent and push for victory.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures and removal spells. With a focus on disrupting the opponent's hand and board state, the deck aims to maintain aggression and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. By utilizing powerful creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Knight of the Ebon Legion, along with versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory in a swift and efficient manner.

The deck focuses on setting up the combo of casting Inverter of Truth to swap libraries, followed by casting Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having no cards left in the library. It includes a mix of control elements like hand disruption and removal spells to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently dig through its library with card draw spells and selection tools like Dig Through Time and Omen of the Sea to find the combo pieces and execute the win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage engines. It also utilizes powerful threats such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Emrakul, the Promised End to close out the game. The deck leverages its ability to fill up the graveyard with cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Traverse the Ulvenwald to enable delirium quickly, allowing efficient casting of powerful cards. The deck's mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of black, green, and blue while also enabling the graveyard synergies.

The main focus of this Spirit Aggro deck is to quickly flood the battlefield with aggressive and evasive Spirit creatures, buffed by Empyrean Eagle, to overwhelm the opponent in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches. The deck utilizes cards like Collected Company to efficiently put creatures onto the battlefield, while also packing disruption in the form of Spell Queller and Rattlechains to deal with opposing threats. With a mix of flying, hexproof, and flash abilities, this deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent into submission.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, then utilize Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, Inverter of Truth, and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. Thought Erasure and Thoughtseize help control the opponent's hand, while Dig Through Time helps find key pieces of the combo. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Hero's Downfall provide protection. The mana base is optimized for the Dimir color combination, with cards like Fetid Pools and Drowned Catacomb ensuring smooth mana production. The deck aims to win through a powerful combo finish using the cards mentioned above.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle combo to win the game. By either decking themselves with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or using Thassa's Oracle's enter-the-battlefield ability, they can win through a quick and unexpected win condition. The deck includes various control elements such as hand disruption and removal spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces as quickly and efficiently as possible while controlling the board to ensure a successful victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost, aggressive white creatures while utilizing the power of enchantments and planeswalkers to support the strategy. It aims to establish early board presence and generate significant value through card advantage and increased creature strength. The inclusion of cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista enhances the synergy of the deck, allowing for both offensive pressure and defensive capabilities. The strategy revolves around maintaining a strong battlefield presence and efficiently closing out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter combo deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Dig Through Time and Thoughtseize, then use Inverter of Truth to swap your graveyard with your library. By having Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle on the battlefield, you can win the game by drawing a card from an empty library. The deck focuses on controlling the game with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while setting up the combo to win. It utilizes a mix of card draw, graveyard manipulation, and disruption to achieve victory.

The deck focuses on playing cheap artifacts and using cards like Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator to turn them into threats quickly. The deck also includes cards like Shrapnel Blast and Metallic Rebuke for removal and protection. The goal is to quickly build a board presence with artifact creatures and pressure the opponent with damage. The deck utilizes a mix of aggressive creatures and spells to consistently apply pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck revolves around quickly manipulating the top of your library to win the game. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Thought Erasure to control your opponent's hand, along with Inverter of Truth to swap your library with your graveyard, you can set up Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to win the game by having no cards left in your library. This combo deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a game-winning win condition through library manipulation.

The Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing various powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Emrakul, the Promised End alongside efficient removal spells such as Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay to control the game's tempo and outvalue opponents. The deck also includes cards like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Liliana, the Last Hope for additional card advantage and recursion. The main strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful win conditions to close out the game.

The focus of this Spirit Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence of flying creatures and pump them up with Empyrean Eagle. Use counterspells like Spell Queller and Rattlechains to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Collected Company allows you to dig for more creatures and further overwhelm your opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures and tempo plays, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and close out the game before they can stabilize. Land base includes mana-fixing lands to ensure smooth gameplay.

This Dimir Inverter deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes card selection and disruption spells to dig through the deck efficiently, while also running protection against opposing spells. The deck focuses on controlling the game early on and then executing the combo to win in a single turn. It combines graveyard manipulation, card draw, and a game-winning combo to create a powerful and streamlined game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with small white creatures and generate mana through Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx in order to ramp into powerful threats such as Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Gideon of the Trials. The deck focuses on aggressive plays with efficient creatures like Thraben Inspector and Knight of the White Orchid, while also providing some disruption with cards like Baffling End and Stasis Snare. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Mastery of the Unseen and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit to generate additional value and resilience.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field, along with cards like Sylvan Scrying and Pore Over the Pages, to ramp up mana quickly and set up a combo win condition. The goal is to get Lotus Field on the battlefield with as many lands as possible to generate a large amount of mana, then use Underworld Breach and Hidden Strings to loop spells and tap/untap Lotus Field repeatedly to dig through the deck and find Thassa's Oracle for the win. The deck also includes Fae of Wishes to tutor for necessary pieces and protect the combo.
